image.alt: Smiling patients and staff at Frazier Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: At Frazier Orthodontics, we believe a healthy, beautiful smile can truly change lives. Since 1999 Dr. James Frazier has delivered exceptional orthodontic care to children, teens, and adults across River Forest, Oak Park, and the greater Chicago area.

From the moment you walk through our doors you’ll feel the difference—our warm, welcoming environment and patient-first approach combine the latest orthodontic technology with personalized treatment plans for comfortable, predictable care.

items.title: Personalized Plans
items.text: We create individualized treatment plans that fit your goals and lifestyle, combining clinical expertise with clear, ongoing communication.

items.title: Advanced Options
items.text: We offer Damon self-ligating braces, Damon Clear, Spark™ and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> aligners, iTero digital scanning, and accelerated options to make treatment faster and more comfortable.

items.title: Convenient Care
items.text: Friendly staff, flexible scheduling including evening hours, free parking, same-day starts, and help with insurance make treatment easy for families and adults.

paragraphs.text: James Frazier, D.M.D., M.S., is a specialist in Orthodontics and Dentofacial Orthopedics who has provided care in River Forest and the surrounding communities since 1999. He earned his Doctorate of Dental Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania and completed his orthodontic residency and Master of Science in Oral Sciences at the University of Illinois at Chicago. Dr. Frazier combines clinical expertise with a patient-focused approach to deliver personalized care for children, teens, and adults.

image.alt: Dr. James Frazier, orthodontist at Frazier Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: We offer a full range of orthodontic care, from discreet clear aligners to modern self-ligating braces and reliable retention options to keep your smile looking its best.

testimonials.author: Paul T.
testimonials.testimonial: “I had been conscious of the spaces between my teeth for years... I only had the braces on for 18 months. By this time, in my late 40s, that 18 months went by quickly. I’m pleased with the results and I wish I had gone ahead with the braces 10 years earlier.”

testimonials.author: Elissa B.
testimonials.testimonial: “Our family could not have asked for a better experience than what we had with Dr. Frazier and his staff. My teenaged son and daughter both agree that they had a great experience.”

testimonials.author: Ellen W.
testimonials.testimonial: “Once I decided to go ahead, I never regretted my decision. The staff helped me every step of the way... Dr. Frazier was always personally involved in my treatments and appointments, and I am overjoyed with the result.”

og_meta.title: Home - Frazier Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Personalized orthodontic care in River Forest, IL — braces, clear aligners, and retention plans from Dr. James Frazier.

image.alt: Frazier Orthodontics team smiling in the office lobby

paragraphs.text: At Frazier Orthodontics we believe a healthy, beautiful smile can truly change lives. Since 1999 the practice has focused on a warm, welcoming environment, individualized treatment plans, and combining genuine compassion with the latest orthodontic technology to deliver comfortable, predictable results for children, teens, and adults.

Experience expert care with a personal touch—let’s create your best smile together. We design treatment plans around each patient’s goals and lifestyle, whether that means braces, clear aligners, or accelerated options.

Our office blends modern digital tools with gentle techniques to keep visits efficient and comfortable. From iTero digital scanning to Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and Damon systems, we offer proven options to help you reach your smile goals.

James Frazier, D.M.D., M.S., is a specialist in Orthodontics and Dentofacial Orthopedics. Since 1999 he has provided personalized orthodontic care for children, teens, and adults in River Forest and the surrounding communities. Dr. Frazier focuses on predictable, comfortable treatment plans and offers a full range of options including braces and clear aligners.

The practice is an experienced Invisalign<sup>®</sup> provider and also offers Damon® Smile and Damon® Clear™ appliance systems, Spark™ aligners, PROPEL, iTero digital scanning, and other modern technologies to improve efficiency and patient comfort.

image.alt: Dr. James Frazier in clinical setting

paragraphs.text: Dr. Frazier earned a Bachelor of Science in Biology from Binghamton University and an MBA in Management Information Systems from Syracuse University. He received his Doctorate of Dental Medicine from the University of Pennsylvania Dental School, graduating with honors, and completed his Orthodontic residency and Master of Science in Oral Sciences at the University of Illinois at Chicago, also with honors.

Originally from upstate New York, Dr. Frazier grew up showing Arabian and National Show Horses, an experience that shaped his work ethic and attention to detail. He is an identical triplet who enjoys traveling with his family, walking Chicago’s lakefront with his dogs, and supporting local organizations such as the Animal Care League in Oak Park.

image.alt: Dr. Frazier holding a small dog

paragraphs.text: Dr. Frazier is passionate about giving back to the River Forest community, supporting local organizations such as the Animal Care League in Oak Park. We believe strong communities help create healthy, confident smiles.
Share a smile — get rewarded. Our referral program thanks patients who refer friends and family with a $50 Amazon gift card after the referred patient begins treatment.

og_meta.description: Meet Dr. James Frazier and discover Frazier Orthodontics' patient-focused approach, advanced technology, and community involvement.

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at orthodontic front desk

paragraphs.text: The first step toward achieving a beautiful, healthy smile is to schedule an appointment. Please complete and submit the request form before your visit so we can prepare for your first appointment.

At your initial exam we'll meet you and your family, perform a complete oral exam with any needed X-rays, review your medical history, and discuss treatment options along with financing and insurance.

image.alt: Parent and child at dental reception

paragraphs.text: We will work with you to create a payment plan that fits your individual budget. Our practice accepts both credit and debit cards for your convenience.
If your insurance covers any portion of orthodontic treatment we will file and process claims on your behalf. We can also help facilitate reimbursements from FSA, HSA, or HRA accounts.
Please take time to complete the patient information form before your first appointment. You can download the PDF forms below, or get Adobe Reader® if you need a compatible PDF viewer.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

seo.page_description: Schedule a free consultation with Frazier Orthodontics. Access patient forms, learn about financing and insurance, and request your appointment online or by ph.
seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, new patient, patient forms, financing, Frazier Orthodontics

og_meta.title: Get Started | Frazier Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Schedule a free consultation with Frazier Orthodontics. Access patient forms, learn about financing and insurance, and request your appointment online or by ph.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at an orthodontic practice

paragraphs.text: The Damon® Smile system uses passive, self-ligating brackets and advanced archwires to move teeth with less friction and lighter forces, which can make treatment more comfortable and efficient.

image.alt: Patient with modern braces during orthodontic checkup

paragraphs.text: Damon Clear pairs the Damon system’s slide mechanism with nearly invisible brackets, combining discreet aesthetics with efficient tooth movement and fewer adjustments.
Patients often appreciate the improved comfort and the easier, low-profile look compared with traditional tied brackets.

image.alt: Close-up of a patient smiling with discreet orthodontic appliances

paragraphs.text: Invisalign for teens uses SmartTrack material and digital planning to deliver comfortable, removable aligners with a compliance indicator to support wear-time goals and predictable progress.
Treatment begins with a digital scan, then a customized plan guides a series of trays that let teens eat and brush normally while straightening teeth.

image.alt: Close-up of clear aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Spark clear aligners are a removable, custom-made option that gradually moves teeth with smooth, clear trays designed for comfort and visibility when worn.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking a selfie

paragraphs.text: PROPEL treatment stimulates the bone surrounding teeth to accelerate tooth movement. Many patients complete treatment faster, and the therapy works with clear aligners, clear braces, and conventional braces.
PROPEL is generally completed in-office with minimal discomfort and no recovery time; speak with our team to see whether it’s right for your case.

image.alt: 3D treatment planning software showing orthodontic simulation

paragraphs.text: Retainers protect your investment by keeping teeth in their corrected positions. We offer removable clear retainers, adjustable Hawley retainers, and bonded fixed retainers.
Care is simple: wear as directed, remove to eat, clean daily with a toothbrush and cool water, store in a case, and call us immediately if a retainer is lost or damaged.

image.alt: Young woman holding an orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: Two-phase treatment begins early to guide jaw growth and create space for permanent teeth. Early intervention can reduce the need for extractions or more invasive procedures later.
Phase One establishes a foundation for proper jaw development and eruption, followed by Phase Two to finish alignment and bite details with braces or aligners.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention

paragraphs.text: Temporomandibular disorders can cause jaw pain, clicking, headaches, and limited opening. We evaluate symptoms and recommend conservative therapies or referrals when appropriate.
If you notice jaw pain, frequent headaches, or changes in bite, contact our team for a thorough exam and consultation to discuss treatment options.

image.alt: Digital X-ray equipment used for orthodontic imaging

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about orthodontics, treatment options, and scheduling at Frazier Orthodontics.
Orthodontics (also referred to as dentofacial orthopedics) is a specialized form of dentistry that focuses on the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of dental and facial abnormalities.

Orthodontists are specialists in moving teeth and aligning jaws. All orthodontists are dentists first. Out of 100 dental school graduates, only six go on to become orthodontists. After completing dental school, the prospective orthodontist must be accepted into an accredited orthodontic residency program and then successfully complete the orthodontic residency program. Residency programs involve two to three years of additional training. The orthodontic resident learns the skills required to manage tooth movement (orthodontics) and guide facial development (dentofacial orthopedics).

accordion.header: What’s the best age to visit the orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: If you want to improve the look and feel of your smile, then any age can be a great time to see an orthodontist. The American Association of Orthodontists recommends that children first visit an orthodontist around the age of seven; however, orthodontic treatment is not exclusive to children and teens. About one in every five orthodontic patients is over the age of 21. Whether you’re considering treatment for yourself or for a child, any age is a good time to visit the orthodontist.

accordion.header: How can I take care of my teeth if I’m wearing braces or a retainer?

paragraphs.text: Always remember to brush your teeth after every meal and floss at least once a day. Use toothpaste that contains fluoride to help prevent cavities. Keep your retainer clean by brushing it gently with a toothbrush and toothpaste, or soaking it in Fresh Guard as instructed by our office. Try to avoid sugary, sticky, chewy, or hard foods that can damage braces or get stuck. Continue routine dental checkups every six months with your family dentist.

accordion.header: If I get braces, how long do I have to wear them?

paragraphs.text: The amount of time spent in braces will vary depending on the individual patient, because every smile responds differently to treatment. Treatment times can take anywhere from six to 30 months, but most standard treatments last about 18–21 months.
Braces generally should not hurt; however, you may experience slight discomfort when the braces are first placed. It may take a few days for your mouth to become accustomed to the braces.

accordion.header: Do I need to brush my teeth more often if I have braces?

paragraphs.text: With braces, you should brush your teeth at least three times a day to keep your teeth, gums, and mouth healthy and clean. Brushing regularly will help remove any food that may be caught between the braces. You should also floss daily to get between your braces where your brush isn’t able to reach. We will show you how to brush and floss properly once your braces are placed.

accordion.header: Will I still see my regular dentist while in orthodontic treatment?

paragraphs.text: Yes. It’s even more critical that patients receiving orthodontic treatment visit their dentist regularly. With braces, food may be caught in places your toothbrush can’t reach, which can lead to cavities, gingivitis, and gum disease. We work closely with your dentist to help keep your teeth clean and healthy during treatment.

accordion.header: Will my braces interfere with my school activities like sports, playing an instrument, or singing?

paragraphs.text: Playing an instrument or a contact sport may require some adjustment when you first get your braces, but wearing braces will not stop you from participating in your school activities. If you play a contact sport, we recommend wearing a mouthguard to protect your braces or appliance.

accordion.header: How do I schedule my next appointment?

paragraphs.text: Simply contact our practice. Our front desk staff will be happy to schedule your next appointment at your convenience. If you are a new patient or have been referred to our practice, please let us know and we will provide you with all the information you need. Appointment scheduling link: https://www.frazierorthodontics.com/appointment-request
